stages.headline: An expression like /K 3^5 K/ is called a power. The number 3 is the base, and the number 5 is the exponent.
To evaluate expressions, we use the Order of Operations: Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication and Division (left to right), and Addition and Subtraction (left to right).
Evaluate this expression: /K [(7^2 - 9) \div 8] \times 2 K/. Show your work on the board.
solutionSteps: First, solve inside the parentheses: 7^2 is 49. So we have [49 - 9].
Then, 40 divided by 8 is 5. We have 5 * 2.

stages.headline: You also use the order of operations when expressions have variables. First, substitute the given number for each variable. Then, follow PEMDAS.
What is the value of /K 9 - 2x \div (z-y)^3 K/ if /K x=4, y=-1, K/ and /K z=-3 K/?
Excellent. Following the correct order of operations is essential for getting the right answer on the SAT.
